title: My Account Glitched on Forums?
body:
So I usually go on the Forums, looking at some new/interesting discussions. As I was looking around, I realised that my account said that I was only level 22, when I am actually level 30. I looked into it on the forums, and I couldn't quite find the information I was looking for. My summoner icon changes, it's just that my level stays the same. This is my first post/comment, so I really don't have any other way of checking if it was my account, some sort of glitch, or just that it doesn't update until a certain amount of time. I really got a {{champion:26}}  questions, and I was wondering if anyone else had this issue or had an explanation.

Thanks!

replies.body:
Hey NeverCat!

While the Boards is linked with game account information, sometimes the information doesn't update properly. There are numerous reasons as to why this can happen. Fixes can include relogging, posting/viewing posts, etc. If all else fails, you can send in a support ticket to us where we have a tool on our side to sync information properly on Boards.

Glad to hear that it's fixed and sorry for that hiccup!

Hey Keyru, I intentionally picked an old post of yours to avoid nosy people, please delete this once you've read it, as the reasoning behind could become counter productive.

Considering your role on boards, I believe this is right up your alley.

For a while now I've wondered how best to approach this subject, as I needed to incorporate some psychology in order to achieve the best result.

I'm referring to **malicious links**, and how best to inform the community, and my solution is that you cannot just hand people the information on a silver platter.
You need to apply logic, reasoning, explain why and how it all fit together, in order to get the point across, and make the individual ponder the unknown, rather than just read and forget about it, the very next day.

I finally made an attempt at it over on the EU boards, but I rather suck at it, and I probably shouldn't mention scripts at all, since I do not wish to promote it in any way or form.

So to quote myself:
> [{quoted}](name=Declined,realm=EUNE,application-id=eZuvYsEr,discussion-id=N12bO6Kf,comment-id=00010001,timestamp=2015-07-30T11:33:08.370+0000)
>
> Could you please at some point provide a deeper understanding of the principles behind phishing links?
> 
> For instance, all malicious links have one thing in common, they benefit the author of the website in some way or form.
> 
> Phishing websites, designed to trick you into giving up your password, thereby stealing your account.
> 
> Pyramid websites, designed to entice your greed by giving you an 'easy' chance at these prizes, if you forward the websites to a certain amount of people.
> Once you've invested this time and reached the milemarker, you are usually:
> A) presented with a survey, this survey provides revenue to the author, while all you get is a long nose.
> B) Given a login form, designed to trick you into giving away your username/password.
> 
> Downloadable "hacks" are usually integrated with a keylogger, worm, trojan, virus or similar, they do NOT unlock skins or give free rp/ip.
> 
> Scripts (No details here)
> 
> tl;dr There's no such thing as free rp/ip/skins, do NOT be fooled.

Sorry for the long post, here's an alot.
http://www.arixystix.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/11/alotmonster01-560x373.jpg
Oh, as soon as I posted this it updated. Well, if anyone has some information, please tell me. Thanks!
